newsitem.title: CANADA: Poll finds 1996 holiday sales better than 1995.
newsitem.headline: Poll finds 1996 holiday sales better than 1995.

text.p: Most Canadian retailers have found sales so far this holiday season have improved over last year's dismal results, the results of a national poll by the Retail Council of Canada and published on on Tuesday showed.

The survey, conducted over the past two weeks, found 41 percent of respondents reported higher sales than in 1995, 28 percent said sales were about the same and 29 percent said sales had fallen. The national council, representing 6,500 merchants, polled 400 small retailers across Canada.
Nearly half of the respondents said total sales would increase over 1995.
A quarter thought 1996 sales will match last year's while a quarter said they would decline, the poll found.

"On average, retailers predicting increases are forecasting Canadian holiday sales will rise 4.5 percent over the corresponding 1995 period, while those predicting decreases said sales will fall 3.2 percent," the survey said.
